articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel expanded evacuation orders in Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip overnight, forcing tens of thousands of Palestinian residents and displaced families to leave in the dark as explosions from tank shelling reverberated around them.
articles.title: Israel orders more Gaza evacuations after school shelter attack kills scores

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched an air attack on Kyiv, with air defence systems engaged in repelling the strikes, Vitali Klitschko, mayor of the Ukrainian capital said early on Sunday.
articles.title: Russia launches air attack on Ukraine's Kyiv, mayor says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Moscow's forces are in their sixth day of intense battles against Kyiv's largest incursion into Russian territory since Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine.
articles.title: Downed Ukraine-launched missile injures 13 in Russia's Kursk, regional officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr on Sunday condemned Chinese air force actions in waters of the South China Sea claimed by both countries, calling the actions "unjustified, illegal and reckless".
articles.title: Philippines says actions of China air force 'illegal', 'reckless'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Abbas Araqchi was nominated on Sunday as Iran's foreign minister by President Masoud Pezeshkian, Iran's parliament speaker announced live on the Student News Network.
articles.title: Iran's president nominates Abbas Araqchi as foreign minister

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The lawyer of the main suspect in a foiled plot to carry out an attack at Taylor Swift concert in Vienna on Sunday sought to play down the seriousness of the plan, saying her client was only "playing with ideas".
articles.title: Austrian Taylor Swift plot suspect's lawyer plays down attack plan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Austria's chancellor said on Sunday his country's intelligence agencies should have greater power to monitor communications on messaging apps to stop extremists after a planned suicide attack at a Taylor Swift concert in Vienna was thwarted this week.
articles.title: Austria chancellor urges more comms monitoring after Taylor Swift plot

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sudan's consultations with the U.S. concluded without reaching an agreement on whether a delegation representing the army or the government will participate in peace talks in Geneva on Aug. 14, the head of Sudan's delegation said on Sunday.
articles.title: Sudanese consultations with US on peace talks conclude without agreement, Sudan official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China supports Iran in defending its "sovereignty, security and national dignity", Chinese foreign minister Wang Yi told Iran's acting foreign minister in a phone call on Sunday, according to a statement by China's foreign ministry.
articles.title: China supports Iran in defending security, says foreign minister

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Germany's chancellor has told Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in a phone call that he should conclude a deal on a ceasefire and the release of hostages held by Hamas, a German government spokesperson said on Sunday.
articles.title: Germany's Scholz urges Israel to conclude hostage release and ceasefire
